item.title: Leah add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Leah add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "The sweetest thing in all my life has been the longing — to reach the Mountain, to find the place where all the beauty came from — my country, the place where I ought to have been born. Do you think it all meant nothing, all the longing? The longing for home? For indeed it now feels not like going, but like going back." -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description:
"The mold in which a key is made would be a strange thing, if you had never seen a key: and the key itself a strange thing if you had never seen a lock. Your soul has a curious shape because it is a hollow made to fit a particular swelling in the infinite contours of the divine substance, or a key to unlock one of the doors in the house with many mansions.
Your place in heaven will seem to be made for you and you alone, because you were made for it -- made for it stitch by stitch as a glove is made for a hand." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I desired dragons with a profound desire." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It would seem that Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at the sea. We are far too easily pleased." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by Rob Bell
item.description: "Christian' makes a poor adjective" -- Rob Bell

item.title: Leah add a quote by Rob Bell
item.description: "The moment God is figured out with nice neat lines and definitions, we are no longer dealing with God." -- Rob Bell

item.title: Leah add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "We cannot live only for ourselves. A thousand fibers connect us with our fellow men; and among those fibers, as sympathetic threads, our actions run as causes, and they come back to us as effects." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Leah add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Leah add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Leah add a quote by Edgar Allen Poe
item.description: "We loved with a love that was more than love." -- Edgar Allen Poe

item.title: Leah add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Leah add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Nothing is so necessary for a young man as the company of intelligent women." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Leah add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "When you love someone, you love the person as they are, and not as you'd like them to be." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Leah add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Love is life. All, everything that I understand, I understand only because I love. Everything is, everything exists, only because I love. Everything is united by it alone. Love is God, and to die means that I, a particle of love, shall return to the general and eternal source." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Leah add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "A quiet secluded life in the country, with the possibility of being useful to people to whom it is easy to do good, and who are not accustomed to have it done to them; then work which one hopes may be of some use; then rest, nature, books, music, love for one's neighbor — such is my idea of happiness." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Leah add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Rummaging in our souls, we often dig up something that ought to have lain there unnoticed. " -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Leah add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "To get rid of an enemy one must love him. " -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Leah add a quote by Moliere
item.description: "Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit." -- Moliere
